JP Morgan CEO: Execs may have pay taken back

The banking company's CEO told Congress that senior executives responsible for a $2 billion trading loss will likely have some of their pay taken back. (AP, 1:09 p.m.)
  • Scott Brown calls on JPMorgan to revoke bonuses

No jail time for driver in fatal N.Z. crash

After pleading guilty, the Boston University student who drove a van that flipped over and killed three other students is free to return home. (Globe, 3:01 p.m.)
  • BU student pleads guilty in deadly New Zealand crash

Greig's sister asked judge to be lenient

In an unsealed letter, Margeret McCusker said her sister "never possessed an evil bone in her body" and wasn't involved in "Whitey" Bulger's crimes. (Globe, 2:17 p.m.)

Sheldon Adelson donates $10 million to super PAC backing Mitt Romney

The billionaire casino magnate and Dorchester native previously backed Newt Gingrich, but met with Romney last month and pledged his support. (Globe, 11:43 a.m.)
